metadata.title: CVE-2024-26592 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd:fix UAF issue in ksmbd_tcp_new_connection() The race is between thehandling of a new TCP connection and its disconnection. It leads to UAF on`struct tcp_transport` in ksmbd_tcp_new_connection() function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26592` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-106-generic - 5.15.0-106.116~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-106-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-106.116~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-generic - 5.15.0-106.116~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-generic-64k - 5.15.0-106.116~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1061-aws - 5.15.0-1061.67~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1063-azure - 5.15.0-1063.72~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1063-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1063.72~20.04.1.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1059-gcp - 5.15.0-1059.67~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1044-gkeop - 5.15.0-1044.51~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1054-ibm - 5.15.0-1054.57~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-lowlatency - 5.15.0-106.116~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-106-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-106.116~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1059-oracle - 5.15.0-1059.65~20.04.1
No subscription required
